review: The Fire works great.  The problem is that you cannot get anything out of it without signing up for Prime.  I was unaware that "getting access" did not mean anything more than I could find movies/TV shows/etc. in which I needed to pay for to watch.  It is great with Prime, and I am still glad that I bought it.  I do think that Prime is worth it, but I would have appreciated knowing this going into my purchase. On another note:  I had Netflix prior to my purchase of the Fire, and I think I am going to keep it.  It is easier for my daughter to just continue using it when on the Fire.
author: William Cecchini

review: This is my second purchase of the Amazon Fire TV.  I have cut all the wires to my cable and have not looked back or had any regrets.  I purchased the  Amazon Prime yearly deal for $99 which includes free movie rentals, games, music, ebooks and free 2 day shipping.  I also subscribe to Hula and Netflix which cost approx. $20 a month for both.  The Amazon Prime averages approx. $9.20 a month.  So I pay about $40 a month for more movies and tv shows that I could ever watch, plus the ebooks and music as a bonus.  Yes, this is a no brainer for people who are on a budget and whose only entertainment is internet and cable.  I should also add that if you sign up for Amazon Prime, you should check for new apps and games every couple of weeks.  I have added sever free movie apps and games that we absolutely love.
